markdownRemark.html:
It‚Äôs hard to believe my last blog post was in 2023. The AutoFL work I mentioned back then was (thankfully?) accepted to FSE‚Äô24, and somewhere along the way it passed 100 citations on Google Scholar. A lot has happened since then, so here‚Äôs a quick roundup of the biggest changes.

  1. I completed my PhD in August 2024

A long journey finally came to an end. Finishing it felt both relieving and bittersweet, and I‚Äôm grateful for all the people who supported me along the way. And.. I still miss COINSE!

  1. I started a new job at Roku Seoul Office in June 2024

I met lots of amazing people there, and the industry experience taught me a lot, and many of those lessons continue to help even now.

  1. Since September 2025, I‚Äôve been an Assistant Professor at Korea University

This was a big decision I‚Äôd been contemplating for years, and I‚Äôm glad I made the leap back into academia. Being able to do research again (and teaching!) has been deeply satisfying. Advising students has been refreshing and genuinely fun. I‚Äôm also thankful for everyone around me who has been incredibly supportive during this transition. ü•∫

These days, I had been working on multiple topics including AutoCrashFL (essentially taking AutoFL ideas into real industrial crash debugging) and also exploring a few new research directions I‚Äôm excited about. I‚Äôm curious to see what kinds of work will come out over the next several years.

I also attended ASE‚Äô25 in Seoul this year, my first in-person conference in a while. As a publicity co-chair, I was also the one behind the ASE‚Äô25 Bluesky account üòè The SE community feels very different in the post-LLM era. It‚Äôs exciting to see people tackling problems that used to be nearly impossible, but at the same time, the uniqueness of techniques feels (a bit) reduced, making it almost like a puzzle to identify what the actual contribution is.

All in all, it has been a period full of change, both personally and academically. Maybe the next blog post will be in 2027‚Ä¶ but hopefully I‚Äôll have good news to share when it comes.
